alert.note: Alert for Laclede (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 03 at 5:45AM CST until March 07 at 8:29AM CST by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM CST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Missouri, including the following counties, Dallas and Laclede. * WHEN...Until 300 PM CST Friday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 542 AM CST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated light to moderate rain showers ongoing. Runoff from rainfall over the last 18 hours is leading to rises on area rivers and creeks, including Bennett Springs. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 1.5 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall of up to 0.5 to 0.75 inches is possible through this morning. - This includes the following low water crossings... North Cobb Creek at Highway B, North Cobb Creek at Ripley Drive, Mountain Creek at Kinfolk Road, Dry Auglaize Creek at Highway BB, Bear Creek at Highway FF, Osage Fork at Auburn Road and Osage Fork at Highway J. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Western Fort Leonard Wood, Lebanon, Richland, Conway, Morgan, Phillipsburg, Stoutland, Bennett Springs, Twin Bridges, Sleeper, Eldridge, Long Lane, Dry Knob, Competition, Falcon, Charity, Lynchburg, March, Olive, Foose and Bennett Spring State Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles.
